bestBHT.bht: But these expressions, far from being inconsistent, only confirm, by their precision, the minute accuracy of the narrative. It can hardly be doubted that the owners of these were Jews, since to them our Lord had now come to offer His services. This will explain what follows: the mountain where this man often was, a great one, with a great herd of swine feeding.

bhtAttempts.bht: But these expressions, far from being inconsistent, only confirm, by their precision, the minute accuracy of the narrative. It can hardly be doubted that the owners of these were Jews, since to them our Lord had now come to offer His services. This will explain what follows: the mountain where this man often was, a great one, with a great herd of swine feeding.

The precise language used in this verse confirms the accuracy of the narrative. It is clear that the owners of the swine were Jews, as Jesus had come to offer His services to them. This detail helps to explain the events that follow. It is worth noting that the mountain mentioned in Mark 5:11 is better aligned with Luke's account. This verse also reveals that the man often frequented this area where a large herd of swine fed, consisting of about two thousand hogs.
